intro: Pediomelum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its small, spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert regions. Pediomelum palmeri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
